reasoning: Rhabdoid tumors are rare malignant kidney neoplasms primarily affecting children under age 5. Estimated to represent 1-2% of pediatric renal tumors (~0.07-0.2 per 100k population). Incidence data from pediatric cancer registries, but rhabdoid tumors are infrequently tracked separately in systematic epidemiological surveys.
source: GLOBOCAN 2005 pediatric cancer data; National Cancer Institute SEER pediatric registry
